strings:
<se_low>Yangus: This church is in the back o' beyond!
I doubt we'll get a clue about Dhoulmagus 'ere.

<se_low>Yangus: Still, beggars can't be choosers, eh?
We're pretty desp'rate, so I s'pose we may as well ask now we're 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: I can 'ardly believe we got a clue about Dhoulmagus out in the sticks 'ere!
<se_low>Yangus: We was right to drop in at the church, eh!

<se_high>Jessica: We chased Dhoulmagus all the way across the ocean, but now what?
We don't have a clue where to go from here!
<se_high>Jessica: Does this mean we're going to have to search this entire continent from end to end?

<se_high>Jessica: I have a bad feeling about this.
We'd better get to Baccarat right away.

<se_high>Jessica: If Dhoulmagus made it there before us,
he's sure to have left a body in his wake.
<se_def>Angelo: Here's a good tip for you. They always let you stay the night for free in remote churches like this one.
<se_def>Angelo: It can be quite handy if you're a bit low on funds.
<se_def>Angelo: Sounds like Dhoulmagus was on his way to Baccarat.
<se_def>Angelo: That place is famous for its casino. Surely he wasn't heading over there for a game of bingo!?
<se_low>Yangus: I dunno why, but there's somefin' about bein' in a church that makes me feel all uncomfy, like.
<se_low>Yangus: I can't 'elp feelin' like the Goddess is judgin' me for all that stuff I did back when I was a bandit.
<se_high>Jessica: You know, churches are the same all over the world.
<se_high>Jessica: I just remembered. Back in Alexandria, Alistair and I used to go to church together every week...
<se_def>Angelo: Here's a good tip for you. They always let you stay the night for free in remote churches like this one.
<se_def>Angelo: It can be quite handy if you're a bit low on funds.

<se_low>Yangus: If only there was some decent god-bloke who'd come along an' sort Rhapthorne out for us.
It'd certainly save us a few 'eadaches, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I wouldn't mind prayin' every day if that's 'ow me prayers was answered!
<se_high>Jessica: You know, churches are the same all over the world.
<se_high>Jessica: I just remembered. Back in Alexandria, Alistair and I used to go to church together every week...
<se_def>Angelo: I doubt it would have much influence on their lives here if news of Rhapthorne reached them.
<se_def>Angelo: It wouldn't do to disturb church life and its tedious daily routine, after all.
<se_high>Red: Blimey, you'd 'ave to be a believer to give yer life over to prayin' in a lonely old place like this, eh? That's real faith, that is.
<se_low>Morrie: Up the ladder inside the church is leading to the bell tower, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Sometimes it is good to climb and do the meditazione with the breeze of the sea in your face.
<se_high>Red: It's impendin' doom ev'rywhere else, but this place just gets on wiv it, eh? Business as usual. Not a bad way to be, I s'pose...
<se_low>Morrie: Sometimes we must clear our heads and just look at the sky. Si, every then and now, I too am doing nothing. Niente. Just listening to the wind passing.
<se_low>Morrie: ...Che? We, we do not have time for doing nothing? Si, maybe you are right.
